title: Issue with module refresh and setup_dependent_environment()
body:
I have package A which set some variable to be used by dependent package B:

``` bash
#Package A
def setup_environment         #same stuff in setup_dependent_environment
      self.spec.archdir = xxx

#Package B
def setup_environment
       arch = self.spec['A'].archdir
```

this works fine for installation. But when I do `spack module refresh` then I see:

``` bash
    main()
  File "/somepath/spack/bin/spack", line 169, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/module.py", line 251, in module
    callbacks[args.subparser_name](module_type, args.specs, args)
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/module.py", line 235, in refresh
    x.write(overwrite=True)
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/modules.py", line 401, in write
    self.spec.package.setup_environment(spack_env, env)
  File "/somepath/spack/var/spack/repos/xxx/packages/B/package.py", line 76, in setup_environment
    arch = self.spec[‘A’].archdir
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 604, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError()
AttributeError
```
